CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 5, 1969, pg. 17 reads: " "Doing Their Thing" - Members of the Milicka Civic Club were caught by photographer "Teenie" Harris "Doing their thing" at their recent "(Dad) Do Your Thing" Cabaret at spacious Rostraver Gardens on Father's Day. From left to right: Estelle Sisco, Patricia Lea Ward, secretary; Evelyn Brock, president; Valerie Troy, treasurer; Arlene Williams, financial secretary; Merla White, corresponding secretary; Dorothy Sizemore and Mary Bean Allen, social chairman.  Each girl has pledged a $500 Life Membership in the NAACP for herself, and to give $1,000 a year for five years to the Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. Memorial Foundation (Southern Christian Leadership Conference).
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of eight Milickas Civic Club members, from left: Estelle Sisco, Patricia Lea Ward, Evelyn Brock, Valerie Troy, Arlene Williams, Merla White, Dorothy Sizemore, and Mary Bean Allen, posed in front of large mural of stylized shapes in Rostraver Gardens for "Do Your Thing" cabaret, Belle Vernon
